column1: Narrator : The crew lowers a plank to disembark directly on a grass field. Behind a few rolling hills, a small cottage can be seen in the distance. It's quite noticeable thanks to the thick column of smoke rising from it's chimney.

column2: Choice : Let’s go towards the house!

column1: PlayerSpeak : We don’t have time for this.
Narrator : CAPITAINE arrives in front of the homely cottage.

column3: OtherSpeak : How dare you come back here!

column2: Choice : Ahoy, smith! Do you happen to sell the weapons you craft? (trade)
column5: Choice : How are things going around here? (quest)

column3: OtherSpeak : With great pleasure! Here's what I have for sale!

column2: OtherSpeak : Yes, but not to people of your kind.
column8: OtherSpeak : I’ve got a small favor to ask of you if you'll listen.

column4: OtherSpeak : You’re fighting the wrong person...
column8: OtherSpeak : My wife is constantly nagging me because she wants some jewels...

column5: OtherSpeak : You wanna gossip, you go and see my wife.
column8: OtherSpeak : But I’m a blacksmith, not a jeweller!
OtherSpeak : If you bring me back some jewelry for her, like pretty earrings or somethin'...
OtherSpeak : I'll let you have a look at what I have in the back of my shop!

column1: OtherSpeak : Did you find something for my wife?
Choice : Yes, here are some pretty earrings. (loot)
column2: Choice : Sorry, I haven't found anything.
column4: Choice : Sorry, I haven't found anything.

column2: OtherSpeak : Erh... She’s gonna be sour for days...
column3: OtherSpeak : Wait… You don’t have anything. You think that's funny?
column4: OtherSpeak : Erh... She’s gonna be sour for days...

column1: OtherSpeak : She's going to be so thrilled!
OtherSpeak : As we agreed, have a look at what I have in store.
Narrator : The blacksmith is dead, but his forge is still burning. Scattered around are a few metal ingots and other materials.

column5: PlayerSpeak : Only rusty pieces of metal.
column6: PlayerSpeak : All sorts of random stuffs, but unfortunately no weapons.

column1: OtherSpeak : What the hell are you doing in my home?!
Narrator : She slumps down on her knees, sobbing uncontrollably.
Narrator : The corpse of the blacksmith's wife lies in the middle of the homely room. Nobody else lives here.

column2: PlayerSpeak : Looks like they ate everything.
column4: PlayerSpeak : Just a few letters and scribblings... some sketches, too...
column5: PlayerSpeak : There’s an old map, leading towards DIRECTIONTOFORMULA.
